alert.note: Alert for Gila Bend; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Southeast Yuma County; Tonopah Desert; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:25PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS PORTIONS OF YUMA AND MARICOPA COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM MST... At 521 PM MST, radar indicated strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles north of Kaka to 13 miles north of Ajo to 32 miles southeast of Dateland to 39 miles west of Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. Conditions are becoming more favorable for the development of additional thunderstorms. Some storms may become strong to severe. Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail will be possible as well as the potential for blowing dust reducing visibilities to below 3 miles at times. Locations impacted include... Gila Bend, Estrella, Wellton, Tacna, Sentinel, Paloma, Big Horn, Bosque, Cotton Center, Painted Rock Dam, Tyson, Freeman, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, Dateland, Sonoran National Monument, Sundad, Mohawk, Mobile, Hyder, and Roll. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 31 and 148. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 34. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 31, and between mile markers 119 and 141. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Gila Bend; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Southeast Yuma County; Tonopah Desert; West Pinal County
